climbs.name: Turtles of a Shell
climbs.fa: Dakota Walz, Jer Collins, and Billy Claycomb

content.description: Climb the center face aiming towards two separate, left leaning crack features. This was the first route put up at Raven Rocks and was done ground up with traditional pro.
content.location: North side of the Lighthouse just left of Arrowhead

climbs.name: Thunderbird
climbs.fa: Jer Collins, Zion Collins, Billy Claycomb, Spanky

content.description: Connect cool pinches and features to a flared hand crack then angle right to the anchors of Turtles.

climbs.name: Lighthouse Traverse
climbs.fa: Dakota Walz, Jer Collins, and Billy Claycomb

content.description: One of the two must do traverses over the water. Climb sustained 5.8 with occasional great rests from one shore line to the next.

climbs.name: Iron Bro-ccoli
climbs.fa: Billy Claycomb, Dakota Walz, and Jer Collins

content.description: Start at little pocket and trend left to the flake and shattered rock. Finish with some slopers and a series of mantels to the big ledge.
content.protection: 4 bolts, shares anchors with Deli Faction
content.location: South side of the Lighthouse, left most route.

climbs.name: Deli Faction
climbs.fa: Dakota Walz, Jer Collins, and Billy Claycomb

content.description: Starts under the big red mega jug, climbs right across a ledge, and climbs the left side of an arête with sweet features.
content.protection: 5 bolts, shares anchors with Iron Bro-ccoli
content.location: South side of the Lighthouse, right route.

climbs.name: Arrowhead
climbs.fa: Jer Collins, Dakota Walz, and Billy Claycomb

content.description: Climb through the super cool huecos and pockets up wonderful sustained moderate climbing. If the start is flooded, traverse in from Turtles of a Shell. First done ground up with traditional pro.
content.location: North side of the Lighthouse and farthest right.

climbs.name: Birds of a Feather
climbs.fa: Billy Claycomb, Jer Collins, Dakota Walz

content.description: This is THE line. Ascending the beautiful east edge of the picturesque standalone tower, this route has the best positioning and top-out of any climb at Raven Rocks and arguably the whole state.
content.protection: 6 expansion bolts, steel lower off anchors

content.description:
The Lighthouse is the aesthetic middle rock featuring a prominent tower and a large half bowl on the lower summit. 

  Here you will find many great moderates and the longer easier of the two water traverses. Birds of a Feather follows the narrow tower to its summit and is not to be missed! 

  Scramble up to the bowl for TR access of the south routes. Continue 4th/5th class to the tower summit for TR access of the north routes.
